text: Sal Rocca (October 29, 1946 - December 13, 2020) was an Italian-born American politician and real estate developer. He was born in Casalvieri, Italy. He was a member of the Michigan House of Representatives from 1975 to 1980, 1983 to 1994, and 2001 to 2004. Before 1992, he was a member of the Democratic Party. Afterwards, Rocca was a Republican. Rocca was raised in Detroit, Michigan. Rocca died of COVID-19 in Troy, Michigan on December 13, 2020 at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Politicians from Lazio Category:Italian businesspeople Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Businesspeople from Detroit Category:Politicians from Detroit Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Michigan
title: Sal Rocca
